New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
Max Muncy tied the franchise record for career postseason home runs with his 13th
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani launched a three-run homer in the eighth inning
Enrique Hern√°ndez hit a two-run shot in the sixth inning
Max Muncy hit a home run in the ninth inning
Walker Buehler struck out Francisco Lindor to leave the bases loaded in the second
Post-Match Reflections: Walker Buehler said the ball was moving around pretty good for him today, and Will Smith did a really good job.
Mets starter Luis Severino fell behind 2-0 in the second, partly due to some shoddy fielding.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers got five stingy innings from their hard-throwing bullpen, and Dodgers pitchers finished with 13 strikeouts.
Game 4 is Thursday night in Queens, with rookie Yoshinobu Yamamoto scheduled to start for Los Angeles against veteran left-hander Jose Quintana.
Others: Shohei Ohtani entered Wednesday batting.222 with a homer and five RBIs during his first postseason.
Ohtani has 17 hits and 27 RBIs in his past 20 at-bats with runners in scoring position, including seven home runs.
